H0.text: Faulting is the geologic process that occurs when the acid in precipitation dissolves certain types of rock.

H1.text: Tilting is the geologic process that occurs when the acid in precipitation dissolves certain types of rock.

H2.text: Weathering is the geologic process that occurs when acid in precipitation dissolves certain types of rock.

H3.text: Erupting is the geologic process that occurs when the acid in precipitation dissolves certain types of rock.

A4.text: Chemical weathering occurs when water, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and other substances react with rock to alter its composition.

A5.text: Carbonic acid, formed by CO2 and water, dissolves calcium carbonate in limestone, leading to carbonate dissolution.
